intro: Cremanthodium stenoglossum, commonly known as the narrow-lipped cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale pink petals. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to cold and harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
